intro: Collomia mazama, commonly known as Mazama's collomia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and meadows. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a rough texture. Collomia mazama plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
